SENT.plain: Clinical features of thalamic strokes have not been well delineated in children
Six children with ischemic thalamic infarcts (3 M, 3 F; age range: 21 months to 14 1/2 years) are reported
Three patients had infarction in the thalamoperforate artery territory and all had a decreased level of consciousness and hemiparesis; two of them also had associated ocular motility abnormalities
One patient with left thalamotuberal artery stroke presented with aphasia
Two patients with thalamogeniculate artery infarcts had hemiparesis and involvement of the posterior cerebral artery
Etiologic factors in our patients were: infectious vasculitis, congenital heart disease, migraine, and unknown in 1 patient each and trauma in 2 patients
Follow-up information was available for 5, 4 of whom recovered completely
One patient was left with a neurologic deficit
We conclude that the prognosis of ischemic thalamic strokes in children is relatively good
